intro: Genista gymnoptera, commonly known as the naked-fruited broom, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees. Its slender, wiry stems are often covered in fine, glandular hairs. Genista gymnoptera is typically found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and coastal areas.
